full_text: Case 1:20-cr-00330-PAE Document 749 Filed 08/10/22 Page 218 of 236 1122 LC3Cmax7 Dawson - direct 1 A. Yes, I did. 2 MS. COMEY: Your Honor, the government offers these in evidence. 3 MR. EVERDELL: Your Honor, voir dire. 4 THE COURT: You may. For the photographs? 5 MS. COMEY: Just the photographs. 6 MR. EVERDELL: I'm sorry, no. No objection to the photographs, your Honor. 7 THE COURT: GX240, 256, 257, 260, and 262 are admitted. Did I get that right? 8 MS. COMEY: 240, 256, 257, 260, 262, and 263. 9 THE COURT: And 263 are admitted. Thank you. 10 (Government's Exhibits 240, 256, 257, 260, 262, 263 received in evidence) 11 MS. COMEY: Ms. Drescher, would you please publish those and cycle through them. 12 You can go to the next one, please. 13 Thank you, Ms. Drescher. We can take that down. 14 Q. Sergeant Dawson, what did you do with all of the items of evidence that you seized during this search? 15 A. I notified the crime scene unit, at which time they took photographs of the items and then placed them in evidence. 16 Q. Who was the head of the crime scene unit at that search? 17 A. Greg Parkinson. 18 MS. COMEY: May I have a moment, your Honor? 19 SOUTHERN DISTRICT REPORTERS, P.C. (212) 805-0300 20 DOJ-OGR-00018319
